Entries.default:
"Ah. A new face in the Valera halls." 

Atello Valera's face is lined and weary, but his coat is tidily buttoned, his posture faultless.
"What can I do for you?"
"All this time we spent wringing our hands over Ezzali only to have our problems solved."
"Can it be so - all of the Bardattos at once?" Atello brings a shaking hand up to his temple.
"I wasn't even there! Blame Belda if you must."
"Well. Is it done? Is the Bardatto family... dealt with?"
"With our new capital, the fleet can be fully restored by month's end." Atello strokes his chin and nods.
"They're gutting the Bardatto estate now. I will try to stifle my regrets." Atello sighs and gestures for you to go on.
"Fair warning - Ezzali Bardatto knows that you're planning to rob her vault."
"I want to talk to you about the Bardattos."
[Leave] "Farewell."
[Leave] "Not yet. I'll be back."
"Robbery, Martino? Please don't tell me..." Atello presses his brow and trails off, shaking his head.
"It was Belda's idea. I may have encouraged her." Martino coughs into his fist.
"Sciòderie! Martino! Now I have to clean up another of your messes."
"What do you want to do about it?"
"Need a hand?"
"I prefer to keep these things in the family, but times being what they are..." He glares at Martino.
"Best of luck. I'm out of here."
"Martino, we are going to have a long talk about who governs this estate and who falls in line."
"Ac. I am only sorry that I was not there to swing my blade into Ezzali's neck."
"If we must. What is it?" Frowning, Atello beckons you to continue.
"I had other questions."
"Certainly. What is it?"

"Here. You may count yourself as one of the family. That grants you the right to this blade."

He passes you a fine sword with the Valera crest etched on the hilt.
"You are a miserable influence on this family."
"You rid me of my greatest rival without apparent cause."
"You're having some kind of trouble with the family next door?"
"This is the richest prospect on Eora, but we cannot grow our family business."
"Ac. The Bardatto bank shuts us out of investments and stifles our finances."
"Ezzali is a rich thug, and some day she will get what's coming to her."
"Ezzali wants to strike a peaceful arrangement."
"After everything that she... madiccho, what is she planning?"
"Am I supposed to play nanny?"
"They listen to you, Martino!"
"See to it that Belda escapes. Leave no Bardatto witnesses who can incriminate us."
"You're not considering this? The Bardattos have nearly ruined us!"
"Tell Ezzali to meet us here. I won't be lured into a trap." He nods to himself and glances around at the state of the house.
"Enough, Martino! I will not let our families tear each other to ribbons while I can avoid it."
"I think your families should consider a truce."
"This is not your feud. If anything, I question your interest."
[Show him the Captain's Report.] "You can't afford to do business here, much less carry on a feud."
"Never mind."
"Ezzali will be sharpening her knives. It's time for us to do the same."
"Gods help my churlish braggart of a son... how did it ever get to this?" Atello turns to you in surprise.
"Infighting like this is hardly in the company's best interests."
"Please. If the Bardattos wanted to finish us off, the governors would hand out dueling blades."
"Martino, don't speak ill of the company under my roof, especially in front of guests." Atello sighs.
"You're a businessman. You would know if my investment was false."
"You... you filthy thief!" Atello's face twists with defensive fury.
"Our financial difficulties are no one's concern but ours!"
"You want to help? Convince Ezzali to negotiate. She ignores my invitations."
"Right. Let us discuss more agreeable matters, then?"

"Here. You may count yourself as one of the family. That grants you the right to this blade."

He passes you a fine sword with the Valera crest etched on the hilt.
"This will not make the company's work easier, but we will step in to help."
"You help and strategize. I'm tempted to sneak into the Bardatto estate with an empty bag." Martino chuckles to himself.
"Ac. I am only sorry that I was not there to swing my blade into Ezzali's neck."
"I've solved your problem. Surely that merits a reward?"
[Attack] "Don't feel too bad. You're next."
"I didn't do it for you."
"Then we cannot be blamed for it. Belfetto."
"Father may not be pleased, but I am." He tosses you a coin pouch and winks.
"Guards, a rat is loose in the house!" Martino unsheathes his sword and advances.
"No matter your reasons, you would not be here unless you wanted something."
"Ezzali offended me. That was cause enough."
"Ha. A killer after my own heart."
"Now you know what I'm capable of."
"Any chance there's a reward for that?"
"And how would the guards react if I am seen paying an assassin?"

"They'll care less if I do it. Everyone knows I'm a terrible man."

Martino winks and tosses you a coin pouch.
"That we do."
"You - What are you doing here?"
"Martino, be silent!" Atello regards you with a furrowed brow.
"Solved it? Madiccho! Who will do business with us, now?"
"Enough. We have a guest."
[Attack] "Ezzali sends her regards."
"You can only stand against the Royal Deadfire Company if you stand together."
"And you would be an expert in such matters, wouldn't you?"
"Stay your tongue, Martino. Learn to hear reason." Atello nods slowly as he scrutinizes you.
"Ezzali's dead. Isn't that enough?"
"Madiccho, not if you left witnesses! Come back when your job is done."
"Until then, leave me be." Atello turns away from you, intent on focusing anywhere else.
"You have little to gain by peace between our families, but you speak as if you might." Atello purses his lips.
"Guards! To arms!"
"Merla! I will put down this Bardatto dog." Grimacing, Martino advances.
"I think Ezzali's very upset."
"Ac, the only thing to do now is strike before she does!"
"What would you have us do - kill Ezzali?" Atello brings a trembling hand up to his cheek.
"Kill all of them. No witnesses. No Bardattos."
"Wait a minute. I didn't come here to sign up for this."
"I'd go myself, but this does not work without a Valera alibi."
"Just stopping by."
"Ezzali asked me to kill you, Atello."

"There, you see? And you still think you can negotiate?"

Martino smirks triumphantly.
"Thought I'd introduce myself."
"Right now we need blades more than we need good neighbors." He aims a knowing look at Atello.
"Anyone ever tell you you're a few spoons short of a silverware drawer, Martino?"
"Is he serious, Atello?"
"But here you are. Ezzali will not look on that kindly."
"Ac. It says something that I am the clear-headed one in the family."
"I'll handle it."
"And I'm supposed to trust you?"
"I will consider it."
"Don't consider for long. The Bardattos are out for blood." Martino banishes you with a wave.
"Ac. We Valeras stick by our allegiances."
"So be it. Corès." Atello turns away, unable to look at his son.
"What does your family do for the Vailian Trading Company?"
"Valera ships escort goods and merchants from island to island across Deadfire."
"The Príncipi dogs show us their stern whenever they spot Valera colors on the horizon."
"You flaccid bazzo!" Atello delivers a stinging slap to each of his son's cheeks.
"Peace, father! The Bardattos have coin to spare."

"It's the Gullet for us if the Huana find out, postenago!" 

Atello raises his palm to slap Martino again, but stops himself as he notices you.

"See! Did I not tell you earlier that a solution would present itself?"

Martino peers out at you from beneath a raised arm.
[Slap him.] "Don't hang your hopes on me, Martino."
"What's going on?"
[Say nothing.]

"Martino talked cousin Belda into robbing the Bardatto vault. The house is on full alert!" 

Atello looks to the door and wipes sweat from his brow.

"We need to get Belda out of there before she's taken and interrogated by the stinking Bardattos! I'll even pay you for it. 

"See, Father? I'm taking responsibility already."

He aims a nervous look at Atello.
"I'll get Belda out of there for you."
"Agracima. May the gods accompany you on this noble endeavor." Martino chuckles to himself, shaking his head.

"Take care of Belda and you won't get pitched to the Gullet with the rest of my house." 

Atello grips his head and sighs.
"Waste no more time."
"My time is not inexhaustible, but I am willing to spare it." He opens his palms and invites you to continue.
"Ac, and I'll gladly take yours for cousin Belda's sake."
Atello turns to his son. They share an uncomfortably long silence.
"Sciòderie. Our disagreements are beyond the point of shaking hands."
"So, Queen's Berth is free of the Bardattos." Atello nods, closing his eyes.
"She put up a good fight."
"One family was humbled, but the Quiet Slave's work is never truly finished."
"Just doing my part."
Atello and Martino trade uncomfortable glances.
Martino's head snaps to the side and a spot of blood forms at the edge of his lip.
"You deserve that and more."
Martino catches you by your wrist. Smiling, he leans in uncomfortably close and twists your arm until you are forced to surrender.
"Are you drunken goats finished squaring off?"
"Ezzali has agreed to meet and discuss terms of peace."
"You really managed to convince that stubborn pŵgra to show up?"
"I'm ready to facilitate peace talks between your house and Ezzali Bardatto's."
"I will send a messenger to fetch Ezzali. Whether she is still receptive to the idea of a truce is ultimately up to her..."
"I... I'll make sure the estate is prepared to receive her, then."
"Let's begin the negotiations."
[Leave] "I'll handle this later."
"If you must, but try not to dawdle. A stalemate only lasts so long." Atello dismisses you with a nod.
"Either you have good news or you have overindulged at the tavern." Atello raises his eyebrow and beckons for you to continue.
"Martino has need of muscle and brains outside of the Valera house." Atello frowns toward his son.
"Tell me about the job."
"I had some questions."
"You mentioned something about a job?"
"I will entertain your curiosity." He gestures with an open palm.
"Orso... would that he had stayed off the streets."
"You've seen how these Bardattos rope us into conflict. It's a miracle that Orso survived this long."
"You kept Larro and Orso from the Beyond. We could use such a mediator."
"You saw the duel, yes? Our feud with the Bardattos spins out of control while we bide our time."
"This again? You try my patience overmuch..." Atello nurses his head and sighs, but waves for you to proceed.
"I hope the Valera name has not been blemished by thievery and treason?" Atello aims a piercing look at Martino.
"Belda spoke highly of your execution of the Bardatto muscle."
"A pity about the scuffle in the vault. Ac, word travels fast in Queen's Berth."
"Valera? I'm pretty sure I caught a member of your family dueling with a Bardatto."
"This place looks pretty shabby."
"[Player Name], at your service."
[Say nothing.]
"Not every family in the Deadfire controls the very flow of currency." His upper lip pulls back.
He shares an uncertain glance with Martino and coughs into his fist.
"Courtly manners are welcome here." He inclines his head.
"Ado. I hear you witnessed an... unfortunate exchange behind the adra mill." Atello aims a troubled look at Martino.
"Hang on - I'm not fighting the Bardattos for you."
"What, you think you will have better luck with Ezzali?"
"Are you with us, or no?" Atello raises his brows and waits.
"I think not."
"I can do better than get involved with petty thieves."
[Attack] "House Valera has seen its last sunrise."
"I'm with you."
"If you won't stand with us, you can fall with Ezzali!" Clenching his teeth, Martino lunges to attack.
"Madiccho! How many times..." Grunting, Atello joins the fray.
Pallegina's jaw clenches as she looks between the two men, but she does not speak.

"Remaro had this saying back on the Sorcerer... 'Always steal from your enemies when the bilge-suckers most be expecting it.'"

He sighs, shaking his head at the Vailians.
"The pirate has more sense than you, Martino! Have you no shame?"

"Mestres, forgive us. We did not come to cause a quarrel."

Pallegina speaks to the pair in a calm, soothing tone. The words come swiftly and easily, as though they have been used on many similar occasions in the past.
"No? To put an end to one, perhaps."
"Postenago! I have no interest in helping you wipe out a high-seated family of the Republics over a petty feud. Are you Vailian or Dyrwoodan?"
"You would have us smile while our enemies kick us in the teeth? Perhaps I am too long out of the Republics." Martino turns to you, setting a hand over his heart.

"Leave it to a swabby from the Republics to think a pirate showing them their rear be a compliment."

The orlan chuckles at his own joke.

"Belfetto. Who are we working for, again?"

She squeezes her eyes shut and rubs her temples in frustration.

"Can't make coin at the expense of others? Now that's a crying shame."

Eyes narrowed, the priestess crosses her arms over her chest.
"If you know a better way of squeezing profit out of these islands, I am open to hearing it."
"It's done."
He nods solemnly.
"You have been playing both sides. This cannot go on."
"Martino, to arms!" Scrambling to retrieve his weapon, Atello advances.
"You will forgive me if I am distracted. Trouble and scandal plague my household."
"This does not mean I trust you without question."
"We are not finished with the Bardattos. There is more red work." He glances toward Atello.
"Gods help us, he is."
"[Player Name], as far as our guards are concerned you were playing dice during the massacre. Ac?"
"Ado. What brings you to the hall of the Valeras?" Atello opens his palm.
"That may stave off Ezzali's vengeance... for a little while."
"I'd be willing to lend a hand."
"Leave it to pirates to play their cowardice as insult."

"Weren't referring to you, ma'am. Only be meaning these Company flog-swallows! And only the ones going round the... I... I ain't patching this leak at all, am I?"

His gaze drops as he rubs the back of his head.
"Guards! An intruder!"
"Good night, Watcher. We can speak in the morning."
"Please, let us speak in my study."
"This is no time to do business. Please, come back in the morning."
"Madiccho- Do not play the clown! Let me sleep in peace."
"Fair warning- Ezzali Bardatto knows you're planning something."

"Eccosi? Are you accusing me of something?" 

Atello's indignant scowl only deepens as he turns to his son.
"...Martino?"
"Cuè? I am always planning something."
"Martino!"

"What can I do if Ezzali worries without cause? 

"She knows nothing that can hurt us."

Martino winks at you.
[Say nothing.]
